message_1: Suppose you are organizing a tennis tournament and you have 12 players. Each player will play against every other player exactly once. How many matches will be played in total?
message_2:
To determine the total number of matches, we can use the formula for combinations, which is C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!), where n is the total number of players and k is the size of the combination (in this case, 2 players per match).

So, we have:

C(12, 2) = 12! / (2!(12-2)!)
C(12, 2) = 12! / (2! * 10!)
C(12, 2) = (12 * 11 * 10!)/(2! * 10!)
C(12, 2) = (12 * 11)/(2 * 1)
C(12, 2) = 66

Therefore, there will be a total of 66 matches played in the tournament.
